column4: can anyone in here help me get my system to output 1920x1080?
my xorg.conf file is located here http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/37636/
maybe.. do you know how to get to your xorg file?
that link is no good anymore.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/37636/ it just worked for me
ah.. you're running it on a Visio?  is that the native res of the visio?
but native seems to be confirmed in other sites at 1920x1080
have you tried "nvidia-settings" or "nvidia-settings" from the command line?
yes, nvidia-settings doesn't show me the 1920x1080 that my tv can display
let me look closer at your xorg.. brb

here's mine http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/37637/  anything with a # is commented out and non functional.. you'll notice that my screen size options are in metric (or some other value). You might have to use that type of referance to get it right.  I googled some time ago for that info.  Sorry I don't have a link.. Also I'm on Dapper (which shouldn't make much differance.)
when logging in change "sessions".  if you don't have gdm installed then sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
the problem is that I can't read the screen on login
